Ingredients.3: 2 tablespoons brown sugar, or more to taste

Directions.1: Whisk teriyaki sauce, apple juice, brown sugar, vinegar, pepper, and garlic together in a small bowl.

Directions.2: Place salmon fillets in a glass baking dish. Pour marinade over top, cover, and refrigerate for 4 to 6 hours.

Directions.3: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.

Directions.4: Remove salmon fillets from the marinade and shake off excess. Pour marinade into a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until reduced, about 5 minutes.

Directions.5: At the same time, grill salmon fillets on the preheated grill until fish flakes easily with a fork, 3 to 4 minutes per side.

Directions.6: Serve fillets with reduced marinade drizzled over top.
